|ftname=Tosa class battleships |ftmain=yes
|dykdate=26 January 2009 |dykentry=... that after being saved from the [[shipbreaking|scrapyard]] by a [[Washington Naval Treaty|U.S. delegation]], two [[Imperial Japanese Navy|Japanese warships]] of the '''{{Sclass|Amagi|battlecruiser|5 |maindate=21 March 2015 }}''' and '''{{Sclass|Tosa|battleship|5}}''' classes, [[Japanese aircraft carrier Akagi|''Akagi'']] and [[Japanese aircraft carrier Kaga|''Kaga'']], were converted to [[aircraft carrier]]s and took part in the [[attack on Pearl Harbor]]?
|action4=FAC |action4date=10:02, 31 August 2013 |action4link=Wikipedia:Featured article candidates/Tosa-class battleship/archive1 |action4result=promoted |action4oldid=570925729 |currentstatus=FA |topic=war |four=no }} {{WikiProjectBannerShell|1= {{WikiProject Japan|class=FA|importance=Mid|milhist=y}} {{WPMILHIST|class=FA|A-Class=pass|Maritime=yes|Japanese=yes|OMT=1}} {{WikiProject Ships|class=FA}} }}
== ''Tosa''-class vs ''Kaga''-class ==
An endnote tells us "The ships are sometimes referred to as the ''Kaga'' class, after the ship that was planned to have been completed first". The Japanese article is titled "''Kaga''-class". I know absolutely nothing about the subject, but this suggests to me that the class is more than "sometimes" referred to as ''Kaga''. [[User:Curly Turkey|Curly Turkey]] [[User talk:Curly Turkey|''¡gobble!'']] 20:49, 21 March 2015 (UTC) :Almost all of the English-language references with which I'm familiar with use ''Tosa'' class, so I'm perfectly comfortable in retaining the current usage.--[[User:Sturmvogel 66|Sturmvogel 66]] ([[User talk:Sturmvogel 66|talk]]) 21:06, 21 March 2015 (UTC) :{{ec}} {{ping|Curly Turkey}} Please see [[ship class]]. The debate on what ship gets the class name varies by country. They've deferred to the referenced sources here. [[User:The ed17|Ed]] <sup>[[User talk:The ed17|[talk]]] [[WP:OMT|[majestic titan]]]</sup> 21:07, 21 March 2015 (UTC) :: I hope nobody thinks I was suggesting changing "current usage"—I was saying that perhaps "''Kaga''-class" was more prominent than the endnote would lead one to believe. I was surprised at the ja.wiki article it linked to, and then even more surprised to find that the only place this discrepency is mentioned is in a endnote. [[User:Curly Turkey|Curly Turkey]] [[User talk:Curly Turkey|''¡gobble!'']] 21:26, 21 March 2015 (UTC) :::I mean, what adjective would you prefer? [[User:The ed17|Ed]] <sup>[[User talk:The ed17|[talk]]] [[WP:OMT|[majestic titan]]]</sup> 21:58, 21 March 2015 (UTC) :::: I would've expect it to see it—maybe in passing—somewhere in the body. Maybe even in the lead (one of those "also known as" things). I was further confused because the ja.wiki article doesn't even mention the term "''Tosa''-class" (although some quick googling indicates that's the fault of that article). Again, I know nothing about battleships, all I know is I was confused. [[User:Curly Turkey|Curly Turkey]] [[User talk:Curly Turkey|''¡gobble!'']] 22:13, 21 March 2015 (UTC)
